entry.title: Depth and Extremal Betti numbers of Binomial Edge Ideals of Unicyclic Graphs
entry.summary: Let $G$ be a connected unicyclic graph on the vertex set $[n]$. In this article, we prove that the depth of $S/J_G$ is bounded below by $n$. Also, we characterize $G$ such that $depth(S/J_G)=n$. We prove that the regularity of $S/J_G$ is bounded below by $iv(G)-1$, where $iv(G)$ denotes the number of internal vertices of $G$. We also prove that if there are trees attached to every vertex of the cycle in $G$, then $iv(G)+1\leq reg(S/J_G)$. If $G$ is a whisker graph of a cycle of girth $k$, then we show that $k-1\leq reg(S/J_G)\leq k+1$. Furthermore, we show that $G$ is a whisker graph of a cycle of girth $k$ such that every vertex of $C_k$ has whiskers if and only if $reg(S/J_G)=k+1$ and in this case $\beta_{n-1,n-1+k+1}(S/J_G)$ is a unique extremal Betti number of $S/J_G$. Also, we show that if there are whiskers at only one vertex of $C_k$, then $\beta_{n,n+k-1}(S/J_G)$ is a unique extremal Betti number and if there are whiskers attached to every vertex of $C_k$ except one, then $\beta_{n-1,n-1+k}(S/J_G)$ is a unique extremal Betti number.
